intro: Buena riedeliana, commonly known as the Riedel's good plant, is a species native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Buena riedeliana is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
